title: 8 herbal tea recipes to boost your immune system
author: Condé Nast; Shradha Shahani
description: Here are some herbal tea recipes from your immune sysytem made with ingredients you are sure to find in your kitchen including turmeric, ginger, tulsi, more
cleaned_text: There are very few things a good cup of chai can't fix. Swap your regular tea for a warm aromatic brew of spices and herbs, and it can go a long way in [ boosting your immunity ](https://www.cntraveller.in/story/boost-your-immunity-eat-indian-superfoods-haldi-turmeric-amla-home-remedies-coronavirus/) and fighting all kinds of diseases. Herbal teas are not your regular cuppas made with tea leaves. They are essentially tisanes, which is an infusion of herbs, spices, fruits and flowers. They are free of caffeine and offer a host of health benefits, from improving digestive systems to reducing stress to fighting colds and coughs. Here are some herbal tea recipes made with [ ingredients ](https://www.cntraveller.in/story/8-indian-ingredients-alternatives-international-ingredients-food-recipes-home/) you are sure to find in your kitchen or garden: Haldi tea Turmeric or haldi is not just the ingredient that lends vegetables and curries its beautiful yellow colour. For thousands of years, it has been used as a medicinal ingredient due to its strong antiviral, antibacterial and antioxidant properties that boost immunity. Most of these come from curcumin, a compound found in turmeric. It's anti-inflammatory properties can also fight pathogens like bacteria and other foreign invaders. Turmeric has also been used as a traditional treatment for digestive conditions. How to make haldi tea at home In a pot of boiling water, add some haldi powder, ginger slices and pepper. Let it boil for 10 minutes. Strain the water and add some lime juice and honey. Ginger tea Ginger is rich in antioxidants and has anti-inflammatory properties that can strengthen your immunity keeping several illnesses at bay. A steaming cup of ginger tea can help reduce nasal congestion and other respiratory issues. [ Research ](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/25912592/) also indicates that ginger can help relieve nausea caused by pregnancy or surgery. Ginger is also a muscle relaxant and can alleviate headaches, menstrual cramps, sore muscles and other kinds of pain. How to make ginger tea at home Peel and slice some ginger. Boil water and add the slices. Strain the tea and discard the pieces of ginger. Add some honey, cinnamon, haldi or lemon juice. Tulsi tea This superfood has antibacterial, antifungal antiviral and anti-inflammatory properties, thereby improving one's immunity. Tulsi tea can prevent respiratory illnesses and reduce phlegm when you have a cough. It is also known to reduce stress, as it lowers the levels of cortisol, a stress hormone in the body. Tulsi reduces blood sugar and cholesterol levels in the body. How to make tulsi tea at home Add some ginger, holy basil leaves and cardamom powder to some boiling water. After boiling for 10 minutes, strain the water. Add some honey and lime juice. You can also get the goodness of ginger and tulsi in one cuppa with this [ recipe ](https://www.archanaskitchen.com/ginger-holy-basil-tisane-adrak-tulsi-chai-recipe) . Lemon tea Lemons are a rich source of vitamin C, a vital nutrient that boosts immunity. Drinking warm or hot lemon water early in the morning helps boost your digestive system. The antioxidants present in them also support weight loss and relieve chest infections and phlegm when suffering from a cold and cough. Its ant-inflammatory properties can combat acne and eczema, improving one's skin health. How to make lemon tea at home Boil some water, add turmeric, lime juice and a dash of [ honey ](https://www.cntraveller.in/story/made-in-india-10-indian-honey-brands-sweet-vocal-local/) to it. Peppermint tea Peppermint tea is known for its cooling properties and to relieve digestive problems such as bloating and indigestion. The aroma also said to reduce nausea and vomiting. Peppermint acts as a muscle relaxant and can relieve headaches and menstrual cramps. Peppermint boasts antibacterial, antiviral and anti-inflammatory properties, so it helps fight clogged sinuses due to allergies or a common cough and cold. Since it is naturally caffeine-free, it is a great tea to drink before bedtime. It's relaxing properties can help you sleep better. How to make peppermint tea at home Fill the pot with boiling water and add some mint leaves. Let it stay for a couple of minutes till the water turns pale yellow. Strain the tea and add some honey and lime. Cinnamon tea Cinnamon is loaded with antioxidants and anti-inflammatory properties. Antioxidants fight off oxidation caused by free radicals, which are molecules that damage your cells and contribute to diseases. Compounds found in cinnamon tea can fight off bacteria and fungi. It controls blood sugar levels and blood pressure, promotes heart health and also reduces pain caused by menstrual cramps. How to make cinnamon tea at home Add 1tbsp of cinnamon powder or sticks to boiling water and let it rest for 15 minutes. Strain the mixture and add some honey for taste. Lemongrass tea Lemongrass has antioxidant properties that kill free radicals that cause diseases in the body. Its antimicrobial functions treat oral infections and cavities. A cup of lemongrass tea can do wonders for an upset stomach, cramping, or other digestive issues. Lemongrass is also known to aid weight loss as it quickens one's metabolism. How to make lemongrass tea at home Add some lemongrass leaves, mint leaves and honey to a boiling pot of water. Let it simmer for about 10 minutes. If you wish to add some caffeine, you could add tea leaves. Strain the water and serve. Hibiscus tea Hibiscus tea is rich in antioxidants that fight free radicals responsible for causing illnesses. It controls blood pressure and could promote weight loss. Its antimicrobial properties also help fight bacteria. Apart from its health benefits, hibiscus tea looks beautiful and is easy to make at home. How to make hibiscus tea at home Separate the flower from the calyx. Wash the petals carefully to get rid of any dirt. Steep the petals in hot water and add some honey and lime juice to it.
